result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raizelle J Schaffer Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.

3:02 PM Defendant Raizelle J Schaffer Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin.  He has been trying to contact SPD but has not yet been evaluated.  Defendant advised of right to attorney.  Defendant given information regarding SPD and court appointed attorney.  Case rescheduled, but court will not schedule another STC with the commissioner after today's hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on August 22, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the victims Kimberly D and MJD except via the telephone. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Kimberly D and MJD. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

02:32 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments by parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
01:49 PM Defendant did not appear.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference on July 11, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

02:39 PM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Raizelle J Schaffer appeared by video means.  Defendant thought the public defender who appeared as his IA was hisa attorney.  Defendant advised of right to attorney.  Defendant given information regarding SPD and court appointed attorney.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the victims Kimberly D. and MJD except via the telephone.
  - Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Kimberly D. and MJD 
  Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 17

03:34 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
